list_definition.definition: the process of discovering something, or something that is discovered

list_ex_of_english: The discovery of vortex structures in the turbulent mixing layer raises serious doubts about the validity of self-preservation arguments.
This evolution towards a fully fledged public exit market resulted from a long process of discovery and change.
Pupils enjoyed exploring the sounds within a pedagogical framework of exploration and discovery rather than in the context of right or wrong compositional choices.
Real discoveries have been made, and many more can be expected from this very promising research avenue.
We shared countless poignant musical discoveries and reflected on many philosophical issues, sometimes seeing eye to eye and other times exchanging differing opinions.
Since its description, the lifecycle of this protozoan parasite has eluded discovery.
Yet, as stated above, its discovery happened at a time when it was still not visible.
When one makes a "discovery," is it the scientific investigator or the dreamer who discovers?
